citation.article-title: Micavibrio admirandus gen. et sp. nov.

p.s: Description of Micavibrio admirandus sp. nov.
Gram-negative curved rods 0.25-0.35 x 0.6-1.0 μ, with a single flagellum 13-15 nm thick.
Motile cells attach to the cell wall of the bacterium, P. maltophilia, lose mobility and develop as exoparasites causing lysis of the infected cells.
They grow only in a culture of P. maltophilia.
They cannot grow in the absence of the host bacteria.
They are resistant to the vibriostatic agent pteridine 0/129.
The GC content of the DNA is 57.1 M%.
The type strain ARL-14 is preserved in the collection of the Institute of Biochemistry and Physiology of Microorganisms of the Academy of Sciences of the USSR.
